body.p:
PHOENIX HOTEL,
Lexington, Ky. Sept. 20 1864
to his Excellency Governor Bramlette
Sir,
I take the great liberty to recommend you Major W. Boyle for the Colonelcy of the 11th Ky Major Boyle is young but General Mareau at the age of 23 was in command of one Army Corps --

I remain of your Excellency
the Most obt St
Capt. Julius Holler A D C
A S S T Insp. Gen of Cavalry

Lexington Ky Sept 20^th^ 1864
To His Excellecny
Gov Bramlit
I fully indorse the recomendation of Cap Passes in behalf of Maj Boyle for the Calvalry of the 11th Ky Cav. he is young But brave and has the confidence of the men

Yours Respectfully
A W Holeman
Late Col Inspr Cav Brigade
Cav Corpt Army of the Ohio

Head-Quarters Military District Kentucky.
OFFICIAL BUSINESS.

Maj. W. O. Boyle
11th Ky Cav &
A. S. G. Gav.

Adjt General - - -
Lt Col Graham to Col & Maj Wlliam A G Boyle as Lt Col.

Thos E Bramlette
Govr

District of Kentucky,
5th DIVISION, 23rd ARMY CORPS.
Lexington, Ky., Sept 20th 1864.
Maj Gen S. G. Burbridge
Comdg Dist of Ky
Genl:
I have this morning been informed that the resignation of Col A. W. Holeman 11 Ky Cav has been accepted. Will you please state officially whither this be true --

I am Genl
Very Respectfully
Your Obdt Servt
W. O. Boyle
Maj 11 Ky Cav
Inspr of Cav D. K.

Lex. Sept. 20th 1864
The resignation of Col. A. W. Holman 11th Ky. Cav. has been accepted

S. G. Burbridge
